caption:
This photograph captures an outdoor scene where industrial or environmental remnants are evident. The main focus is a large, dark, oil-like spill that stretches down the middle of the composition, over concrete surfaces. The spill has a reflective sheen indicative of a viscous liquid, likely oil or a similar pollutant. It starts in a wide patch at the top of the image and narrows as it trickles down, surrounded by a rough, irregular surface.

Adjacent to the spill, the ground transitions from concrete slab to a more natural, rocky terrain with scattered snow patches, suggesting a cold climate or recent weather that included snow. A few small twigs and debris are scattered across both the concrete and rock surfaces, contributing to a sense of unattended, possibly neglected space.

The sunlight is bright, casting harsh shadows and contributing to the stark contrast between the shiny, wet-looking spill and the rough, matte textures of the surrounding ground. The setting does not include any human activity, emphasizing the desolate impact of pollution in a natural or semi-urban environment.
title: Waste runs into the Columbia River from sluice at Vancouver's Interstate Bridge.
